intro: Pedicularis holocalyx, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which is part of the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow petals and a unique floral structure that resembles a monkey's face. It thrives in alpine environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas at high elevations. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and ecologically significant species.
